summary: This document is an email chain from August 28, 2019, among U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) staff. It discusses administrative approval for travel to Palm Beach for a proffer session with a witness in the ongoing investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's co-conspirators, and mentions a prior successful meeting with victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the ongoing investigation; the email discusses travel related to investigating his co-conspirators.

events.title: Meeting with Victims
events.description: A meeting was held with victims of Jeffrey Epstein, which was described as very helpful to the ongoing investigation and for which the victims were grateful.

events.title: Planned Travel for Proffer Session
events.description: Prosecutors from the USANYS plan to travel to Palm Beach for a proffer session with a witness (name redacted) regarding the investigation into Epstein's co-conspirators. They plan to fly in on a Tuesday and out on a Wednesday.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein's co-conspirators as of late August 2019.
Prosecutors had recently held a successful meeting with victims, who were described as 'very grateful'.
The office was planning immediate follow-up travel to Palm Beach for a proffer session with a witness in the co-conspirator investigation.
The email chain shows internal administrative procedures for approving travel and expenses related to the investigation.
Multiple names and email addresses of USANYS personnel are redacted in the document.
